# Facilitator Notes Template

This template provides structure for session delivery notes, making sessions repeatable for meetups, workshops, and self-study.

**Session**: [Session Number and Title]  
**Duration**: [X] minutes  
**Type**: [Conceptual / Hands-on / Mixed]

---

## Pre-Session Checklist

- [ ] Review session content in `docs/meetup/`
- [ ] Review learning content in `src/`
- [ ] Test all examples (if applicable)
- [ ] Verify all links work
- [ ] Prepare demo environment (if needed)
- [ ] Review common questions/FAQs

---

## Timing Breakdown

| Segment | Duration | Activity |
|---------|----------|----------|
| **Introduction** | 2-3 min | Set context, learning goals |
| **Core Concepts** | 15-20 min | Main topics from agenda |
| **Hands-on / Applied** | 10-15 min | Exercises, demos, practice |
| **Summary + Q&A** | 5-10 min | Takeaways, questions |

**Buffer Time**: 2-3 minutes for transitions

---

## Delivery Notes

### Opening (2-3 minutes)

**Key Points to Cover**:
- [ ] Why this session matters
- [ ] How it builds on previous sessions (if applicable)
- [ ] What artifact learners will create
- [ ] Learning objectives

**Suggested Opening**:
> "Today we're exploring [topic]. By the end, you'll understand [key concept] and have created [artifact]."

### Core Concepts (15-20 minutes)

**Topic 1: [Topic Name]**
- **Key Points**: [List 2-3 critical points]
- **Common Confusion**: [What learners often misunderstand]
- **Certification Focus**: [How this relates to exam]

**Topic 2: [Topic Name]**
- **Key Points**: [List 2-3 critical points]
- **Common Confusion**: [What learners often misunderstand]
- **Certification Focus**: [How this relates to exam]

**Transition Phrases**:
- "Now that we understand [concept], let's see how it applies to [next concept]"
- "This is important for the certification because..."
- "Let's move from theory to practice..."

### Hands-on / Applied (10-15 minutes)

**Exercise/Demo**:
- [ ] [Exercise description]
- [ ] Expected outcome
- [ ] Common pitfalls to watch for
- [ ] Time allocation

**Discussion Prompts**:
- "What challenges do you see with this approach?"
- "How would this work in your team's workflow?"
- "What questions do you have about this?"

### Summary (5-10 minutes)

**Key Takeaways**:
1. [Takeaway 1]
2. [Takeaway 2]
3. [Takeaway 3]

**Deliverable Review**:
- [ ] Review what learners should create
- [ ] Provide template or example if needed
- [ ] Allow time for questions

---

**Why it happens**: [Reason]

## Demo Checklist (if applicable)

- [ ] GitHub account access configured
- [ ] Repository created for demo
- [ ] Required permissions set
- [ ] Code examples tested
- [ ] Backup plan if demo fails

---

## Post-Session

### Key Takeaways to Reinforce

1. [Takeaway 1]
2. [Takeaway 2]
3. [Takeaway 3]

### Next Steps

- [ ] Review artifact with learners
- [ ] Point to next session
- [ ] Share additional resources
- [ ] Collect feedback

### Follow-up Resources

- [Link to learning content in `src/`]
- [Link to related labs]
- [Link to exam prep materials]

---

## Adaptations for Different Formats

### Self-Study
- Learners can take longer on each section
- Encourage note-taking during artifact creation
- Provide self-check questions

### Live Meetup
- Keep timing strict
- Use breakout rooms for exercises (if virtual)
- Reserve 5-10 minutes for Q&A at end

### Workshop (Extended)
- Can expand to 60-90 minutes
- Add more hands-on exercises
- Include group discussions
- Deep dive into specific topics

---

- [Domain 2]: [How this session covers it]

### Key Exam Topics

- [Topic 1]: [What learners should know]
- [Topic 2]: [What learners should know]
